document_title: Elbow pain: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Factors that can increase the risk of diseases that cause elbow pain include:
Age: Elderly people are often at higher risk of the disease.; Gender: Most forms of arthritis often occur in women, or gout occurs more often in men; Genetic factors: People with a family history of rheumatoid arthritis, lupus erythematosus, psoriatic arthritis... will have a higher risk of developing elbow arthritis than other groups of people.; Occupation and daily life: People who work strenuously and regularly perform repetitive movements that affect the elbow are often at higher risk of joint pain and inflammation of the tendon attachment points around the joint.; Infection: Infection can give rise to various forms of arthritis and periarticular soft tissue inflammation.
subsection_title: dau khop khuyu tay.json. Subjects at risk of disease
